thread.title: Hempstalk pays for Waterfront Park permit; festival is set
thread.title_full: Hempstalk pays for Waterfront Park permit; festival is set | OregonLive.com

author: Andrew Theen | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Hempstalk pays for Waterfront Park permit; festival is set
text:
Hempstalk festival organizers paid the Portland Parks Bureau nearly $17,000 on Wednesday for a permit to use Tom McCall Waterfront Park this weekend.
With a Thursday deadline nearing, the marijuana-and-hemp celebration had been in doubt. Now, Parks Bureau spokesman Mark Ross said, it's on.
Organizer Paul Stanford said Wednesday morning that coordinators of the free-admission event are cramming seven months of work into about a month.
"We didn't have our date until 30 days ago," he said, because the Parks Bureau had denied its permit application. The City Council reversed the denial in August.
Stanford expects higher attendance this year because, he said, the festival won't have "over-the-top security measures" such as fences and bag searches.
Parks and police officials have been at odds with Hempstalk for nearly two years, saying organizers did a poor job controlling drug use at previous festivals. Parks officials twice denied a permit only to have the City Council ask the bureau to try to make it work.
-- Andrew Theen
